reviews.review_msg: In order to access this course, we first had to complete almost 50 quizzes and modules on plagiarism and academic integrity. 50. It took me almost 4 hours. This is by far the most tedious, mindnumbing prof I've ever had. She assigns a massive amount of meaningless work that doesn't teach you anything (like literally copying and pasting stuff).
One of the sweetest people ever! Her online course was fairly easy and allowed for a lot of flexibility.
The course is more tedious than anything; lots of writing. 8 assignments 10-20% each. If you put a decent amount of effort in and communicate with your TA it's an easy A.

Weird course with lots of reflective and artistic assignments. Course is composed of quite a few assignments that are worth 10-20% and one is due nearly every week. Requires a certain level of effort and care, but shouldn't be too difficult if you're comfortable with reflective/creative assignments.

Very time consuming. Project/paper due almost every... single... week... It will leave you with no time for other classes, or a social life for that matter. Basically a lot of work for very little reward in terms of knowledge and GPA (I walked out with a C+)

Carolyn is one of the sweetest person alive. she's very passionate about teaching and cares about all her students!!! Educ 199 is definitely one of the best courses i've taken at SFU.  workload consist of an individual project, group project, 3 narratives, attendance/participation.

Marela has a passion for her field, and her style of teaching reflects it. She teaches based on the needs of the students, and every class is different. There's more than enough time to do assignments, and due dates are flexible. She'll review your papers and give feedback up until the due date. Her marking is fair as long as you put in the work.

The best prof I've had at SFU! She is so understanding, super easy to get ahold of via email, and very supportive of her students learning. I would very much recommend taking this class with her. The class itself is structured very well and very interesting. 10/10

Zuzana is a super caring and understanding professor, she was always helpful with extensions and genuinely seemed concerned for her students' well-being. The course is engaging and not heavy whatsoever, based on your own interests/life, also super well organized and easy to keep up with

She is so kind. I emailed her about being unable to access something on Canvas & she replied very quickly saying she was so sorry for the inconvenience & if it delayed my work I could take a few extra days to complete the assignment. So compassionate. Take a class with her if you can! She also sends very nice weekly emails to the class.

Took this course as a gpa booster but it didn't turn out that way. Assignments were graded more harshly than I expected. Dr.Zuzana's feedback was pretty accurate, and she responded to my emails quickly.

Zuzana is a very caring professor who truly wants the best for her students. Each class involved working in groups and sharing thoughts in front of the class is not uncommon. Her care for students is very evident as she knows everyone by name and talks directly to students throughout the term. Overall an amazing professor!

Zuzana was hands down the best professor I have had in my 4 years at sfu, and im not even an education major. she is beyond kind and provides you with the coolest class that pushes you to think critically about yourself and reflect on who you are as a person and what you need in order to succeed in life. Best class ever, 10/10 recommend to take it!

Zuzana is an incredibly thoughtful and caring person. Her feedback is detailed and she plans assignments according to students' needs. She is very accessible outside of class and will respond to emails quickly. Occasional tech difficulties. Show up, participate, do the work and you'll get a good grade. Thank you Zuzana for a wonderful semester!
Fatima seems like an easy and kind professor, but she was quite hard to get ahold of throughout the semester and does not offer much feedback on assignments.
